question: Which of the following is also known as Bowen's disease?

A 32-year-old female, gravida 2 para 1 presents to the maternity clinic for her antenatal visit. She has a mitral valve replacement done previously. Which department will be particularly involved in her antenatal care?

A 40-year-old lady P3+0, previous normal deliveries, known diabetic, presented to the clinic with complaints of heavy and painful periods for 2 years. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is soft, 10-week size, and tender, both fornices were clear. Pelvic ultrasound shows an endometrial thickness of 12 mm with a boggy uterus, diffused endometrium, and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is the common cause of hematosalpinx?

A 27-year-old multigravida at 39 weeks of pregnancy is in the active second stage of labor for 2 hours. On examination uterine contraction is 4/10 (30, 35 seconds). On per vaginal examination, the os is fully dilated, vertex presentation at +1, and occipitoanterior position. How will you manage her?

A 36-year-old lady, G6P5+1, who previously had all normal deliveries, delivered a live female baby of a weight of 4 kg. After delivery of the placenta, she starts bleeding heavily. On palpation, the uterus was found to be soft and boggy so uterine massage was done and uterotonics were also administered, but her bleeding did not settle. What is the next step in the management of this patient?
Schiller-Duval body is diagnostic of which of the following ovarian tumors?
Which of the following is the most common type of diabetes mellitus in pregnancy?

A 25-year-old lady, para 0+0 comes to the clinic at 6 weeks of gestation. Her ultrasound report is showing a gestational sac of 3.5 cm size in left adnexa with no heartbeat and an empty uterine cavity. No free fluid is seen in the pelvis. Her serum beta hCG is 2500 IU/L. She is asymptomatic and her vitals are normal. What treatment option would be appropriate for her?

A 28-year-old lady, Mrs. Draper, married for 3 years, comes with a complaint of failure to conceive since marriage, lower abdominal pain, and dyspareunia. Her abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is normal in size but is tender and has limited mobility. A cystic swelling is felt in the right adnexa of about 4 x 4 cm; nodularity is felt in the pouch of Douglas. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 35-year-old female patient comes to the gynecology outpatient department to discuss the ideal method to avoid pregnancy with better compliance. Her doctor decides to give her injectable contraceptive depot medroxyprogesterone acetate. Which of the following is the most common and important undesirable effect of injectable contraceptive depot medroxyprogesterone acetate?
Which of the following is the most aggressive testicular germ cell tumor?

A 28-year-old woman who is para 3+1, whose last-born child was two years ago, attends gynecology outpatient department due to amenorrhea for three months. She has had a history of irregular periods for nine months. She also complains of cold intolerance and weight gain in the last six months. Her husband was using condoms regularly and had no leakage accident. What is the most important investigation which you'll suggest to her?

A 25-year-old woman who is a known case of chronic kidney disease and on treatment for it has delivered a baby at 38 weeks of gestation. Weight of the baby is 1.7 kg. How will you categorize the newborn?

answers.option: Low birth weight and small of gestational age
Low birth weight and intrauterine growth rate retardation

question: A 38-year-old nulliparous patient complains of bleeding between her periods and increasingly heavy menses. Over the past 9 months, she has had oral contraceptives and anti-prostaglandins which have not decreased the abnormal bleeding. Which of the following option is best for this patient?

answers.option: Perform a D and C procedure under general anesthesia
Start the patient on high-dose progesterone agent

question: A medical student is describing the growth pattern of a child with growth hormone deficiency. Children with isolated growth hormone (GH) deficiency usually have which of the following?

answers.option: Show deceleration of growth velocity and fall away from growth normal curve
Growth parallel to but below the normal growth curve

question: A case of placental abruption was admitted with the following condition: blood pressure 60/40 mmHg, pulse 140 beats/min, abdomen hard and tender, and fetal heart sounds absent. Mild vaginal bleeding is present and serum creatinine is 1.6 meq/L and INR is 1.2. What serious complication she has developed?

A 56-year-old lady, menopausal for 10 years presents to the clinic with a history of abdominopelvic mass and weight loss since 5 months. On investigation, she was diagnosed to have an ovarian tumor. The most common ovarian tumor in this age group would be:
Spermatocytic seminoma differs from classic seminoma as the former shows which of the following features?
Primordial germ cells arise in which of the following?

A 60-year-old female is diagnosed with bilateral adenocarcinoma of the ovaries. On histopathology and radiology, both tumors are confirmed as independent primary tumors. Which of the following tumors has highest chances of bilateral presentation?

A 30-year-old lady, G4P3+0, previous normal deliveries, known diabetic presented to the outpatient department for routine antenatal visit at 33 weeks of gestation. On examination, her vitals are within normal range. On abdominal examination, her symphysio-fundal height is 30 cm with fetal heart sound of 132 breaths per minute. Her ultrasound showed normal fetus of an age of 30 weeks, normal amniotic fluid index, and doppler studies showed normal waveform pattern of umbilical vessels. What is most likely diagnosis?

A 25-year-old primigravida with a 39-week pregnancy, a known case of gestational diabetes is on insulin therapy and came in the outpatient department for taking the date of delivery. On ultrasound, the weight of the baby is 3.5 kg. Which one is the best management option for her?

A 50-year-old female was diagnosed with ovarian carcinoma. Her past history is remarkable for endometriosis. The tumor in this case is most likely to be associated with mutation of which of the following genes?

A 50-year-old female presents to the outpatient department with heavy menstrual bleeding and weight loss. On examination, pallor is present but jaundice is not. Per abdominal: Uterus is enlarged with irregular margins and restricted mobility, no palpable lymph nodes. Vaginal examination: the uterus is of 18 weeks in size, irregular margins, fornices clear. Her endometrial biopsy confirms endometrial carcinoma. Her MRI done shows a 6 cm by 7 cm irregular mass in the uterine cavity invading the myometrium and cervix. There is no breach of serosa or involvement of adnexa or enlarged lymph nodes. What is the appropriate surgical approach considering her MRI?

answers.option: Total abdominal hysterectomy with bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy

question: A 16-year-old girl visited the gynecology outpatient department as she has not started to menstruate. On examination, she is short-statured with a webbed neck and her nipples are widely spaced. Her blood pressure is 110/70 mmHg and her pulse is 82 beats/minute. What is the diagnostic test for her?

A 49-year-old lady, para 5+0 came to the outpatient department and wanted to know about investigations for assessment of menopausal status. What would be the level of LH/FSH in her perimenopausal status?
Anterior pituitary gland secretes LH and FSH due to stimulation by which of the following?

A newly married couple rush to the clinic early in the morning and told you about unprotected sexual activity last night. They want to have contraception right now. Which of the following post-coital contraception will be effective for the purpose?

A 40-year-old lady, P3+0, with no previous normal deliveries, a known diabetic, presented to you in the outpatient department with a complaint of heavy and painful periods for two years. Abdominal examination is unremarkable. On pelvic examination, the uterus is soft, 10 weeks in size, and tender, both fornices were clear. Pelvic ultrasound shows an endometrial thickness of 12 mm with a bulky uterus, diffusely thickened endometrium, and normal ovaries. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 37-year-old lady G4 P3+0, previously having all normal deliveries, known case of diabetes, presents in the outpatient department for a routine antenatal visit at 33 weeks of gestation. She has a history of intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) fetus in her previous pregnancy. On examination, her vitals are within normal range. On abdominal examination, her symphysio-fundal height is 30 cm with a fetal heart rate of 132 beats per minute. Her uterus shows a fetus of 30 weeks, decreased amniotic fluid volume, and doppler studies showed mild placental insufficiency. What is the most significant risk factor in her history leading to this condition?

answers.option: History of IUGR in previous pregnancy

question: A baby delivered at 38 weeks of gestation by an emergency cesarean section did not establish respiration after birth. After stimulation and drying, the baby was given positive pressure ventilation. The most appropriate indicator for effective ventilation is:

A 25-year-old female, P1, housewife, presents to the outpatient department with a lump in the vagina for 2 weeks. Initially, it was causing no symptoms but for the last five days, it has been immensely painful. For the past two days, the pain has improved but there is a dirty discharge. On examination, she is vitally stable, afebrile, and per abdominal examination is unremarkable. On perineal examination, there is a 2×2 cm round swelling along the left lower edge of labia minora close to posterior fourchette with pus coming out from a punctum and the skin overlying it is red and hot. The rest of the vaginal examination is unremarkable except for tenderness along with the swelling. What are the most likely diagnosis and management?

answers.option: Inclusion cyst, perform incision and drainage
Bartholin cyst abscess, start antibiotics, may require marsupialization

question: Apnea is defined when there is a cessation of respiration for more than a certain time limit. You are called to examine a baby who is not breathing. You will diagnose apnea of newborns if there is a cessation of respiration for more than which of the these?
Yolk sac tumor in adults are most commonly seen in combination with which of the following neoplastic tumors?
The low grade serous carcinoma of the ovary carry highest frequency of mutation in which of the following genes?
Anovulatory cycles occur due to prolonged stimulation by which of these hormones?

A 40-year-old primigravida comes into the clinic at the 12th week of gestation and requests for screening test for Down syndrome. What screening test is recommended for Down syndrome in the 1st trimester?
What is the most debilitating complication expected in a neonate who is untreated with serum bilirubin 22 mg/dl and indirect 18 mg/dl on 1st day of life?

A 33-year-old woman presents to the clinic with pain in her pelvic region. The doctor advises an ultrasound to investigate the cause and it shows a 10 cm, fluid-filled, ovarian cyst. Histopathology shows cyst lined by stratified squamous epithelium with hair, sebaceous glands, and neural tissue. Which of the following neoplasms is most likely?
If a baby is born with a birth weight of less than 2500 g (2.5 kg) and the measurements are taken within the 1st hour of life, the baby is categorized as:

A young lady presents with irregular vaginal bleeding. She is concerned for her health because her mother had cervical carcinoma. The gynecologist advises a pap smear testing which reveals cervical intraepithelial neoplasia. Cervical intraepithelial neoplasia is strongly associated with which of these?

A 30-year-old lady, Mrs. ABC, married for 3 years, came with a complaint of failure to conceive since marriage. She has had heavy menstrual bleeding and lower abdominal pain for one year. On per abdominal examination, she has a pelvic mass of around 18 weeks size. Pelvic ultrasound showed a fibroid of 12 × 10 cm in the fundal region. What is the best treatment option for this patient?

A 48-year-old female, P3+0, had her menopause one year ago, and her BMI is 30 kg/m2. She is a known case of diabetes mellitus and presented to the outpatient department with complaints of urinary incontinence and dysuria for the past month. What do you think is the reason for her urinary incontinence?

A 32-year-old lady comes to the outpatient department, she has a parity of 3, known case of diabetes for 2 years, and is currently on drug therapy. She has a history of one anomalous baby which was an intrauterine death. She wishes to take information for conception but is afraid due to the previous baby. Which investigation will suggest at this time to check for the possibility of anomaly?
The type of endometrial hyperplasia which has considerable morphological overlap with well differentiated adenocarcinoma is:

A 52-year-old woman presents to you in the outpatient department with a large abdominopelvic mass of about 30 weeks size. It has a heterogeneous appearance on ultrasound with solid and cystic components. The rest of the pelvis and abdomen appear normal. There is no ascites, the cancer antigen 125 level (CA) is raised to 430 units, she is asymptomatic. What is the best management option for this patient?

answers.option: Ultrasound guided aspiration of ovarian cyst fluid for cytology
Debulking surgery including total abdominal hysterectomy, prophylactic bilateral salpingo-oophorectomy, and lymphadenopathy
Repeat scan and CA 125 levels after 3 months to check for interval changes

question: Adding a progestin to the estrogenic component of hormone replacement therapy for postmenopausal women provides which of the following effects?

answers.option: Reduces the risk for endometrial cancer
Provides better control of problematic hot flushes

question: A 7-month-old child was brought to the outpatient department with a complaint of the absence of left testis in the scrotum since birth. On examination, the scrotum was empty on the left side and the testis is palpable in the inguinal canal. What should be the plan of treatment?

answers.option: Surgery is required after 2 years of age
Surgery should be performed around one year of age
Surgery should be deferred till puberty

question: A 27-year-old woman, parity 1+0, wants a reversible form of contraception. After reviewing the various options, she chooses depot medroxyprogesterone acetate. Which of the following statements need to be stated clearly to your patient in counseling?

answers.option: May delay the return of fertility after discontinuation
It may cause weight gain in some patients
The mode of action is inhibition of ovulation
This may cause a loss in bone mineral density

question: A 28-year-old nulliparous woman comes to the outpatient department with inability to conceive for three years. She has a history of pelvic inflammatory disease treated two years ago. Which of the following is the gold standard test for tubal pregnancy?
The most common malignancy of breast is:

A young patient, P2, with previously normal deliveries, comes to the outpatient department at 37 weeks of pregnancy with mild pains. On abdominal examination, the lie is longitudinal but presenting part is not cephalic, which suggests breech presentation. Which investigation is required to confirm your diagnosis in managing a patient as a case of breech delivery in early labor?

A 28-year-old lady, gravida 3, parity 2, came in the emergency room at 34 weeks of pregnancy with signs of shock and bleeding per vagina. On examination, her abdomen is tense and tender, and fetal bradycardia on cardiotocography. Which one is the most probable diagnosis?

A newborn baby was brought to the neonatal intensive care unit soon after birth with the complaint of delayed cry for ten minutes. The baby was born at 42 weeks of gestation via spontaneous vaginal delivery by a midwife at home. On examination, the baby was lethargic, had a weak Moro reflex, pupils were bilaterally constricted, and muscle tone was decreased. What is the stage of hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy?

A couple presents to a high-risk outpatient department for early pregnancy counseling. Both partners are beta-thalassemia minor and this is their first conception. The woman is 8 weeks pregnant and wants to know the risk of thalassemia major in their child and earliest method of diagnosing the problem in child. What is the risk of thalassemia major in this child and by what method of testing can it be detected at earliest?

answers.option: 25% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling
50% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling
10% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling
5% can be tested by chorionic villus sampling

question: A 28-year-old patient, parity 3+0, all are vaginal deliveries, and the last born is 9 months back, had unprotected intercourse four days ago. Her last menstrual period was about 2 weeks back. She consults you for emergency contraception. The best available option for her is:

A 32-year-old woman, parity 3+0, came to the gynecology clinic as she has had amenorrhea for six months. She has had severe headaches on and off for four months, and her last born is five years ago. Her pregnancy test is negative. Her serum prolactin level is raised. The progesterone challenge test is negative. The most common cause of hyperprolactinemia causing secondary amenorrhea is:
A 35-year-old woman, para 4+0, presents with second-degree uterovaginal prolapse two months after the delivery of her last baby. What will be the appropriate treatment option for her?

A 35-year-old male patient comes to the clinic with a complaint of heaviness in his scrotal region for six to seven months. On physical examination, he has enlarged left testis. Laboratory reports show elevated AFP = 82 ng/ml, HCG = 15 IU/L. His ultrasound reveals 6 cm mass in left testis. Excisional biopsy is performed. Histopathology reports exhibit cords and sheets of undifferentiated cells with enlarged nuclei and primitive glandular pattern. Which of the following most probable diagnosis?

A 22-year-old woman passes grape-like masses in the 16th week of pregnancy. She had left fetal movement. On examination, she measured 18 weeks uterus. Dilatation and curettage (D&C) is performed. Histopathology exam shows large avascular villi along with trophoblast proliferation. Which of the following is the best method to employ her follow-up care?
Which of the following become uncontrolled vicious cycle in child health?

A 24-year-old primigravida came in the outpatient department at 30 weeks of gestation with a complaint of headache. On examination, her blood pressure is 140/190 mmHg and urine D/R shows no proteinuria. What would be the most likely diagnosis?

A 33-year-old female is a known case of hypertension, G6P3+2, unbooked case, presented to you in the emergency department at 33 weeks of gestation with a complaint of absent fetal cardiac activity. On examination, her BMI is 32 kg/m2, blood pressure is 150/100 mmHg, pulse 90 beats per minute, temperature 98.6F. On abdominal examination, her abdomen is soft, non-tender, symphysiofundal height is 28 cm, lie is longitudinal, and presenting part is cephalic with reducing liquor on palpation. There is no pervaginal bleeding and pain at the moment. What do you think is the cause of intrauterine fetal demise in this patient?
Pruritis most commonly seen in which kind of breast cancer?
Rh disease is uncommon with which number of pregnancy?

A full-term male baby was delivered by instrumental delivery. The baby cried after stimulation. On examination, he had labored breathing. Suction was done and the airway was opened but the condition did not improve. The next appropriate step is:

A 25-year-old banker, para1+0, came to the gynecology outpatient department with complaints of vaginal discharge on and off, for which she has taken multiple treatments. She has a history of passive smoking. She is concerned about screening tests for cervical carcinoma. What is the best screening test for cancer of the cervix?

answers.option: Human papilloma virus screening and liquid base cytology

question: A 40-year-old female was diagnosed with adenocarcinoma involving the right ovary. Her past history is remarkable for endometriosis in the right ovary. What would be the most likely diagnosis in this case?

A G5 P4+0 is referred to a clinic at 35 weeks of pregnancy with laboratory reports showing platelets 35000/mm3 and increased transaminases. Her blood pressure is 180/130 mmHg. The most probable cause of low platelets would be which of the following?

A woman comes to the outpatient department with complaints of breast development and bone pain. On examination, her height is 120 cm, her weight is 22 kg, and her blood pressure is 110/70 mmHg. There are multiple large jagged hyperpigmented macules present on her trunk. Investigation shows raised T3 and T4 along with lytic lesion on a long bone. What is the likely diagnosis?
A woman with the polycystic ovarian disease will also have:

A woman, with sickle cell disease, presents in the emergency department at 30 weeks gestation with severe bone and joint pain and shortness of breath. She is diagnosed with a case of sickle cell crisis. What should be the ideal management line in her case?

answers.option: Give her analgesics, hydrate her, and discharge her
Admit, call seniors, start hydration, oxygen, analgesia, antibiotics, arrange blood, heparin and assess fetal wellbeing
Admit in ward for observation and send her test for infection screening and start treatment after reports arrive
Admit, call seniors, start hydration , oxygen, analgesia, antibiotics, arrange blood, heparin, and deliver by cesarean section
Admit and plan for emergency cesarean section to relieve her symptoms

question: A 20-year-old, G2 para 1, previously had a normal delivery and came into labor with 7 cm dilation and extended breech presentation. The baby's size is average and there are no other risk factors. Which is the first step to deliver the head of the baby after the delivery of body?

The doctor has just delivered a child of an 18-year-old woman (G1 para 0), who is pre-eclamptic. Her uterus is soft with moderate to heavy bleeding. Examination reveals no laceration. What is the most common cause of postpartum hemorrhage (PPH)?
Tumors of the fallopian tube are rare. Which of the following is the most common primary tumor of the fallopian tube?

A 16-year-old obese girl presented with mild hirsutism and oligomenorrhea. She was advised for lifestyle modification and exercise to achieve a normal body mass index. What is the beneficial effect of weight reduction in her case?

answers.option: Decreased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & increased free testosterone
Decreased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & decreased free testosterone
Increased sex hormone binding globulin (SHBG) & decreased free testosterone

question: A 28-year-old G2 para 1, came in the outpatient department at 30 weeks of monochorionic monoamniotic (MCMA) twin pregnancy. She brought her ultrasound that showed twin pregnancy with one amniotic sac having oligohydramnios and other polyhydramnios. Which complication is diagnosed in ultrasound?
Solid papillae without fibrovascular cores are seen in which type of carcinoma in situ?

A 46-year-old male patient presents with urinary obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination shows that the patient has prostatic enlargement and is diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia. The physician decides to start finasteride. Which of the following is the mechanism of action of finasteride?

answers.option: Reducing LH secretion from pituitary hence reducing the testosterone synthesis
Having dual inhibitory effects on LH secretion from pituitary and testosterone synthesis from testes
Lowering circulating as well as prostatic dihydrotestosterone concentration
Blocking testosterone receptors in the prostate gland

question: A 31-year-old, G2 P1, the woman at 40 weeks of gestation has progressed in labor from 4 cm to 7 cm cervical dilation over 5 hours. In the next 3 hours, her cervical dilation remains the same that is 7 cm and so does the station having optimum uterine contractions. The fetal hearts heard are reassuring. Which of the following best describes the labor?

A 34-year-old woman (gravida 4, para 3) at 38½ weeks, whose pregnancy is complicated by gestational diabetes, is in labor. The head delivers, but the shoulders do not follow. An efficacious method of delivery for shoulder dystonia includes the McRoberts maneuver. This maneuver is described as which of the following?

answers.option: Rotation into an oblique position after delivery of posterior arm
Rotation of posterior shoulder to anterior

question: Which of the following is not a therapeutic use of estrogen?
Which of the following is the most common germ cell tumor?

A 28-year-old female patient diagnosed with tuberculosis two months back and currently on antituberculous drugs requested an oral contraceptive pill. Concurrent use of which of the following antituberculous drugs is likely to cause the failure of oral contraception likely because of inducing cytochrome hepatic system?

About 10-month-old Farah is brought to the pediatric clinic with a complaint of cough for 3 days. The child is febrile but taking feed well. Her respiratory rate is 72 breaths per minute but no chest in-drawing. According to integrated management of childhood and neonatal illnesses guidelines (IMNCI), she will be classified as which of the following?

A 60-year-old post-menopausal female presents with abnormal uterine bleeding. Radiology showed a 6 cm polypoid mass in the endometrium. On hysterectomy, the microscopic examination showed a carcinomatous component comprising of serous carcinoma and a sarcomatous component showing osteosarcoma. What is the best possible diagnosis?

Mrs. Jack, P2+0, had a normal vaginal delivery eight days ago and she wishes to travel out of the country for five months. The doctor advises her to visit an obstetrician in that country at least once six weeks postpartum for postnatal care. She argues that her pregnancy and delivery and postnatal period so far are all normal and healthy, so what is the need for further checkups? Why do you have to counsel her on the importance of postnatal assessment and review?

answers.option: It is a part of your delivery package so we offer you to free checkup in that country
It is important because it is routine recommendation
To assess your physical and mental health and guide on contraceptive or further pregnancies as per your desire
It is important because every country has there own care system so she must go and assess there system of care

question: A low-risk primigravida presents to the labor ward at 28 weeks with frank leaking. She has no palpable contractions, is vitally stable, afebrile and her cardiotocography is reactive. What are the best immediate management steps?

answers.option: Discharge with follow up after 1 month
Admit, give injection, corticosteroids, start tab erythromycin, check NICU status
No need for admission or follow up
Admit, send blood culture, decide antibiotics

question: A 25-year-old lady para 0+0 came at 5 weeks of gestation with a serum B HCG report. She is complaining of pain in the lower abdomen. Abdominal examination revealed tenderness in the right lower abdomen. What is the minimum level of beta hCG at which transvaginal ultrasound can help to exclude ectopic pregnancy?
A woman with gestation diabetes delivered a 4 kg baby. The commonest neonatal complication you anticipated in this baby:

A 32-year-old woman married for five years, G4P2+1, presented to you in the outpatient department at 26 weeks of pregnancy with an ultrasound report showing oligohydramnios. Which of the following cause has the worst prognosis?

A young female presented with complaints of pain and red discoloration of her breast. She was experiencing great difficulty in breastfeeding her newborn. Clinically, she was febrile and her nipples were cracked. What is the most probable diagnosis in this case?

A 49-year-old male patient presented with ureteric obstruction and lower abdominal pain. Examination showed that the patient has prostatic enlargement and was diagnosed with benign prostatic hyperplasia (BPH). Which of the following is the steroid 5-alpha reductase inhibitor that has been useful in BPH and male pattern baldness?

A 25-year-old Mrs. Blue is G6 P2+3 non-alive baby with 2 (26 weeks NNDS) due to preterm birth and 3, 18, 16 and 15 weeks miscarriages . She is currently 10 weeks pregnant. She has no history of infection in prior pregnancies and has no known in her or her family. What is the best management strategy in this pregnancy to prevent preterm delivery and miscarriages considering her history?

answers.option: Performing US for cervical lengths or offering her cerclage on basis of her history and managing her in tertiary setup
Give routine antenatal care and just tocolyse once in labor
Reassure her, there is nothing to worry at this stage of pregnancy
Starting her in prophylactic antibiotics till term
Give routine care and give steroid injection once in labor

question: A semen fluid analysis report shows: pH >7.2, motility >80%, sperm count: 20 million/mL, ejaculate: 1.5 mL. These results are described as:
A 28-year-old woman suffers from a 3rd degree perineal tear following the delivery of her baby. What this type of tear involves?

answers.option: Perineal muscles and external anal sphincter
Tear in perineal muscles and the rectal mucosa
Tear in rectal mucosa and the anal sphincter

question: An ovarian tumor is biopsied to reveal cells containing large vesicular nuclei and clear cytoplasm. This tumor was most likely a:
What is the Tanner stage associated with the breast having a secondary mound?
A young woman presented with amenorrhea with raised prolactin levels. What is the next best step in the investigation?
A pregnant woman is diagnosed with gestational diabetes and has an HbA1C level of >85 mmol/mol. What is the risk of fetal mortality?
What is the 5-year survival rate for stage 1b vulvar cancer?
What is the cause of hirsutism in a patient with polycystic ovarian syndrome?
What is the definition of maternal death?

answers.option: Death occuring during pregnancy or within 42 days of delivery from non-accidental causes
Death occuring during pregnancy or within 42 days of delivery from accidental causes
Death within the first 3 months of pregnancy

question: A 28-year-old woman, para 3+0, came to the gynecology outpatient department with a history of heavy menstrual bleeding for one year. On abdominal examination, no abnormality could be detected. On per vaginal examination, the vulva and vagina are normal and the cervix is firm. The uterus is 8 to 10 weeks in size and mobile and on ultrasound, two fibroids of 2x2 cm are seen in the uterus. Her hemoglobin is 10 g/dL. What is the most appropriate first treatment option for her?

A 38-year-old nulliparous patient complains of heavy bleeding between her periods and increasingly heavier periods. Over the past nine months, she has had oral contraceptive pills (OCPs) and anti-prostaglandins, which have not reduced the bleeding. What is the next best step?
What is the management of asthenozoospermia?
Which of the below enlisted is not an absolute contraindication to combined oral contraceptive pills (COCPs)?

answers.option: 38-year-old woman with hypertension and vascular disease
35-year-old woman who smokes > 15 cigarettes per day

question: Intrauterine growth restriction (IUGR) is defined as ultrasound-estimated fetal weight below what percent centile?

A 28-year-old female, G3 P1+1 is brought to the emergency department with severe lower abdominal pain and vaginal bleeding for the past 3 hours. She is currently at the 10+3rd week of gestation. Ultrasound abdomen reveals an adnexal mass with serum beta-hcG levels of 5178 mIU/ml. She previously had an ectopic pregnancy and underwent a salpingectomy for it. What is the treatment of choice in this case?
The unfused portion of the Mullerian duct gives origin to which of the following structures?

answers.option: Fallopian tubes, uterus and upper cervix

question: A 25-year-old primigravida presents to the emergency room with regular painful uterine contractions and is admitted to the labor suite. She progresses upto 7-cm dilatation of the cervix, with full effacement. 3 hours later, cervical dilatation is still 7-cm. What is the provisional diagnosis?

answers.option: Arrest in secondary stage of labor

question: What is the pre-pregnancy weight of the uterus?
The death of a mother during pregnancy or within 42 days of birth is termed as which of the following?
Highest rate of mortality and complications in infant life is during what time period?
A primiparous woman consults her obstetrician with the concern that she is unable to feed her baby as she is unable to produce milk. What is the appropriate management?

answers.option: Reassurance and teach mother positioning of baby
Prescribe cow milk and dilution techniques with iron supplements
Prescribe galactagogue and teach mother positioning of baby

question: A healthy baby delivered via cesarean section develops tachpnea with subcostal and intercostal recessions soon after birth that resolve in one day without medications or oxygen supplementation. What is the most likely cause?
A 75-year-old female presents with a mass on the vulval region extending to the lower 5 mm of the urethra. Biopsy proves vulval carcinoma. What is the best treatment option?
A 35-year-old woman consults her gynecologist with the complaint of postcoital bleed. On examination, a red colored mass is seen protruding from the vagina. What is the diagnosis?

A 40-year-old, para 5+0, known case of diabetes, presents to the outpatient department (OPD) with a complaint of vaginal discharge and itching. Per vaginal examination reveals a thick white curdy discharge. What is the likely diagnosis?
What is true regarding combined oral contraceptive pills and cancer risk?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the outpatient department with the complaint of inability to conceive for the last 4 years. She has regular menstrual cycles and has a past surgical history of appendectomy 2 years back. What is the likely cause of her infertility?
What is the effect of pregnancy on the thyroid status of the body?
What is the most common etiological factor for ectopic pregnancy?

A 25-year-old woman, G1P0, presents for her regular antenatal checkup at the 24th week of pregnancy. Her serum hemoglobin level is 8.9 g/dL. She was diagnosed with thalassemia minor during her childhood. What is the next step in her antenatal management?
A baby is delivered with skin covered by a greenish material. What is the potential complication?
A baby is born with meconium staining on his skin. He shows good respiratory effort and has a heart rate greater than 100 beats per minute. What is the best initial management?

answers.option: Intubation and suctioning, bag mask ventilation

question: Which one of these is not an absolute contraindication to oral contraceptive use?

answers.option: Age greater than 35 years and heavy smoking
History of chronic hypertension with vascular disease
Breast feeding woman with a 1 month baby

question: Which one of these hormones causes the ejection of milk?
What is the prognosis for stage 2 of hypoxic-ischemic encephalopathy?

answers.option: 40 percent will develop permanent neurological deficit
50 percent will develop permanent neurological deficit

question: A 30-year-old woman is diagnosed with hyperthyroidism. Further investigations reveal that a mass in the ovary is responsible for her condition. What is the most likely pathology?

A woman is in the second stage of labor for the last 1 hour and she is exhausted from the contractions. The fetal station is +1. She has had 3 spontaneous vaginal deliveries before this. What is the next best step?

answers.option: Wait another hour for normal delivery

question: A 25-year-old woman, who had a delivery a week ago, comes into the clinic and expresses that she is worried that she might develop diabetes. Which of the following is the best test to perform in this case?

answers.option: Normal physiologic blood pressure in pregnancy

answers.option: Estrogen antagonizes the effect of progestin

answers.option: It is calculated as weight (kg) divided by squared height (m2)
It is calculated as weight (kg) divided by cubed height (m3)

It is calculated as mass divided by cubed height (m3)
It is calculated as weight (kg) divided by height to a population-specific exponent

question: Which of the following is not a contraindication of combined oral contraceptives (COCP)?

answers.option: 35-year-old woman with diabetes and peripheral vascular disease

question: The baby presented with pallor and jaundice on 2nd day of life. Mother's first baby did not have jaundice, at birth. The mother’s blood group is A negative whereas the baby’s blood group is O positive. What is the most likely cause for this condition?

A 1.5-year-old child presents to the outpatient department with a complaint of cough for the past four days. On examination, he is afebrile, his respiratory rate is 30 breaths per minute, and no chest indrawing and stridors are observed. He can breastfeed as per usual. What is the classification of this child's disease according to IMNCI?

A woman presented to the labor ward with normal labor. However, in the last 40 minutes, her CTG started showing a fetal heart rate greater than 180 beats per minute, baseline variability greater than 25 beats per minute, and variable decelerations. The patient's blood pressure dropped, and her pulse rate increased. What is the initial step in the management plan for this patient?

answers.option: Perform full set of maternal observations
Exclude acute events (e.g. cord prolapse, suspected placental abruption, or suspected uterine rupture)
Continue performing CTG until results become normal
Document a plan for reviewing the whole clinical picture and the CTG findings
Talk to the woman about what is happening and take her preference into account
